newsitem.title: JAPAN: JGBs up by noon on public fund purchases.
newsitem.headline: JGBs up by noon on public fund purchases.

text.p: The cash and futures Japanese government bonds (JGBs) were up by Tokyo noon on Tuesday led by large lot purchases by public funds, namely the Postal Savings System, traders said.
"Postal Savings appeared to have bought the longer-end of the cash bond market, driving up futures too," said a European bank trader.

U.S. speculative accounts bought back JGB futures as they might have thought the yen debt yield curve has steepened a bit too much, traders said. The key September was at 124.55 at noon, up from 124.10 on Monday.
The yield of the benchmark 182nd 10-year JGB was at 2.310 percent at 0220 GMT, down from 2.375 percent on Monday.
Helped by demand from institutional investors, the September easily broke above its near-term resistance at 124.40 and 124.50 by noon.
Local agricultural financial institutions were on the buy-side in the market, accentuating the JGB's advance.
The Ministry of Finance (MOF) said on Monday that it would reduce its bimonthly issue volume of four-year and six-year JGBs to 400 billion yen each from their 500 billion yen each.
